/home/haiyan/Research/CentralizedAgentFr.content_with_line_numbers:
1â†’module adder_16bit #(
   2â†’    parameter WIDTH = 16
   3â†’) (
   4â†’    input           clk,
   5â†’    input           rst,
   6â†’    input  [WIDTH-1:0] a,
   7â†’    input  [WIDTH-1:0] b,
   8â†’    input             cin,
   9â†’    output reg [WIDTH-1:0] sum,
  10â†’    output reg        cout,
  11â†’    output reg        overflow
  12â†’);
  13â†’
  14â†’// Internal signals for carry propagation
  15â†’reg [WIDTH:0] carry;
  16â†’
  17â†’// Combinational logic for addition and overflow detection
  18â†’always @(*) begin
  19â†’    // Initialize outputs
  20â†’    carry[0] = cin;
  21â†’    
  22â†’    // Ripple-carry adder implementation
  23â†’    for (int i = 0; i < WIDTH; i = i + 1) begin
  24â†’        carry[i+1] = (a[i] & b[i] & carry[i]) | 
  25â†’                     (a[i] & ~b[i] & ~carry[i]) | 
  26â†’                     (~a[i] & b[i] & ~carry[i]) | 
  27â†’                     (~a[i] & ~b[i] & carry[i]);
  28â†’    end
  29â†’    
  30â†’    // Compute sum and output carry
  31â†’    sum = a ^ b ^ carry[WIDTH:1];
  32â†’    cout = carry[WIDTH];
  33â†’    
  34â†’    // Overflow detection for signed numbers:
  35â†’    // Overflow occurs when two operands with same sign produce result with opposite sign
  36â†’    // i.e., (a[15] == b[15]) && (a[15] != sum[15])
  37â†’    overflow = (a[15] == b[15]) && (a[15] != sum[15]);
  38â†’end
  39â†’
  40â†’// Synchronous register update on clock edge
  41â†’always @(posedge clk or posedge rst) begin
  42â†’    if (rst) begin
  43â†’        sum <= {WIDTH{1'b0}};
  44â†’        cout <= 1'b0;
  45â†’        overflow <= 1'b0;
  46â†’    end else begin
  47â†’        // Outputs are updated synchronously based on combinational logic
  48â†’        // The combinational logic drives the values, which are registered here
  49â†’        // This ensures proper timing and avoids combinational loops
  50â†’        sum <= sum;
  51â†’        cout <= cout;
  52â†’        overflow <= overflow;
  53â†’    end
  54â†’end
  55â†’
  56â†’endmodule

test_scenarios: Test case 1: Add two positive numbers within range
Test case 2: Add two negative numbers (check overflow)
Test case 3: Add max positive and min negative
Test case 4: Edge case with cin=1 and all bits high
Test case 5: Zero inputs with cin=1
